description.content:
안� �한 먹거리, 위생수준 등 식품안� � 관리 높은 � �수 평가 받아 남해군은 경남도의 2010년도 식품안� �관리 추진실� � 평가결과 '우수기관'으로 � � �됐다. 군은 경남 18개 시·군을 대상으로 한 평가에서 한해 동안 해수욕장 등 식품안� � 관리 및 식중독 예방관리, 집단급식소 위생수준 향상, 식품안� �관리 � �책 수립 및 � �도 개� 등에 대해 노� �한 � �이 높은 � �수를 받은 것으로 분석됐다. 특히, 군이 지향하� 있는 환경농업도시 건설과 2012년 여수 세계박람회를 앞두� 관광객과 군민들에게 안� �한 먹거리 공급과 위생수준 향상을 위한 노� �이 이번 평가로 연결되어 성과로 나타났다는 � �에서 더 큰 의미가 있다. 군은 군내 관� � 단체와 지속� �으로 식품안� �의식 및 식중독 사� �예방, 식품안� �을 위한 소비자 보호운동에 � �극 나서� 있어 타 지방차지단체로부터 주목받으며 많은 지역에서 벤치마킹을 다녀가기도 했다. 군은 이번 결과에 만족치 않� 앞으로 친환경 식품에 대한 식품 안� �관리를 더욱 강화해 업무추진의 효율성을 높이는 것은 물� 각 업소와 공무원이 열심히 일하는 분위기를 조성하여 나간다는 방침이다.
한편, 이번 평가결과에 따른 시상식은 내년초 경남도 주관 식품안� �관리 컨퍼런스에서 있을 예� �이다. (끝)

description.hltext_display: В Эстонии обнародованы материалы о финансировании Москвой политической деятельности мэра Таллина
description.content:
, Москва, 09:52 Полиция безопасности Эстонии (КАПО) обнародовала в среду информацию, согласно которой председатель крупнейшей оппозиционной партии, мэр Таллина Эдгар Сависаар просил у российской стороны предоставить "законспирированным способом" финансовые средства на строительство православной церкви в таллинском районе Ласнамяэ, а также на проведение избирательной кампании по выборам в парламент, сообщает "Интерфакс".
Как отмечается в сообщении, обнародование произведено по распоряжению комиссии по безопасности правительства.
Согласно приказу главы полиции безопасности Райво Аэга о досрочном снятии по распоряжению комиссии грифа секретности с гостайны следует, что Сависаар 9 февраля на ужине с участием президента ОАО "Российские железные дороги" Владимиром Якуниным, вице-мэром Таллинна Денисом Бородичем и руководителем администрации ОАО "РЖД" Владимиром Бушуевым попросил средства на строительство церкви.
Якунин во время того же визита заявил, что готов выделить на церковь 1,5 млн евро (около 23,5 млн эстонских крон). С февраля по октябрь через эстонскую фирму "S Petromaks Spediitor" на счет Эстонской православной церкви Московского патриархата было переведено на строительство храма около 13,5 млн крон.
Кроме того, Якунин 24 июня во время посещения Эстонии пообещал Сависаару, что Партия центра получит к намеченным на 6 марта парламентским выборам 1,5 млн евро. Из этой суммы одна треть будет передана наличными, две трети - перечислением на основании счетов. Как следует из документов КАПО, Якунин заявил участникам беседы, "что о сделке никто ничего не должен рассказывать".
"Якунин потребовал в дальнейшем по этому делу придерживаться строгой конспирации, сославшись на свой многолетний опыт оперативной работы", - говорится в отчете КАПО. Это касалось полного запрета на использование телефона при обсуждении темы выделения денег, достижения договоренности о встречах и других "деликатных вопросов".
24 июня во время увеселительной прогулки на катере по Таллиннскому заливу Якунин сообщил, что "запрошенных трех не получат, получат полтора".
По данным КАПО, Сависаар и Якунин 6 ноября во избежание возможного скандала обсудили необходимость подписания трехстороннего договора о легализации выделенных на Ласнамяэскую церковь средств. Договор о финансировании строительства церкви был подписан 26 ноября. На следующий день Сависаар представил его в мэрии Таллинна.
В минувший четверг близкая к правительству эстонская газета Postimees опубликовала статью, в которой утверждалось, что полиция безопасности предоставила президенту Эстонии, премьер-министру и министру внутренних дел доклад, в котором Сависаар назывался "угрозой для безопасности страны" и "агентом влияния" России.
В ней отмечалось, что Сависаар попросил для своей партии 25 млн крон, при помощи которых мог бы, по мнению КАПО, увеличить влияние России в Эстонии.
В ответ на это Сависаар заявил, что намерен обратиться в Совет Европы для расследования нарушения прав религиозных меньшинств в Эстонии. "Сейчас в Эстонии разгорелся международный скандал вокруг строительства православной церкви. Мы обратимся с запросом ко всем Церквам, может ли помощь строительству церкви и добывание для этого денег быть преступлением", - заявил Сависаар на пресс-конференции в Таллине. "Мы обратимся и к Совету Европы, чтобы инициировать обсуждение на тему того, как защищаются права религиозных меньшинств в Эстонии", - сказал мэр.
Накануне по этому поводу высказался президент Эстонии Тоомас Хендрик Ильвес. Он осудил идею финансирования Россией политической деятельности в Эстонии под видом займа на строительство православной церкви.
Президент отметил, что "неразумно для политика, председателя партии, мэра столицы также просить деньги на строительство храма у иностранного государства и без оповещения общественности. Особенно, когда эта акция связана или ее можно увязать с выборной кампанией".
По его мнению, само строительство церкви не осуждается, но оно должно происходить так, чтобы не давать оснований для обвинений в этически сомнительной деятельности.
По мнению руководства страны, строительство церкви лидер оппозиции и мэр Таллина намеревался использовать в своей предвыборной борьбе в канун намеченных на 6 марта 2011 года парламентских выборов.
Сам Сависаар отверг обвинения и заявил, что в условиях экономического кризиса, вызванного действиями правительства, власти в очередной раз в ходе предвыборной кампании начинают использовать "русскую карту", чтобы отвлечь внимание населения от истинных проблем страны.
60-летний Эдгар Сависаар занял должность мэра Таллина 5 апреля 2007 года. С 1990 по 1992 год он был премьер-министр Эстонии, Сависаар также занимал пост министра экономики и коммуникаций в правительстве Андруса Ансипа.
Центристская партия, председателем которой является Сависаар, является коллективным членом Европейской либерально-демократической и реформистской партии. После присоединения к партии 20 августа 2005 года Эстонской партии пенсионеров партия стала второй по величине в Эстонии. В настоящее время в партии состоит более 9000 человек. Наибольшую поддержку партии оказывают пенсионеры, а также русскоязычное население, которому импонируют выдвигаемые антинационалистические лозунги.

description.hltext_display: E. Creek catches top Gleneagle b-ball prize
description.content:
others also read...
Terrace Standard
BC North
Updated: December 21, 2010 1:46 PM
It was the Gleneagle Talons’ New Year’s Classic but it was the Enver Creek Cougars who did all the celebrating Friday.
The Cougars of Surrey danced past North Vancouver’s Argyle Pipers 77-60 in the final of the eight-team senior boys high school basketball tournament in Coquitlam.
Burnaby’s Byrne Creek Bulldogs dumped the host Talons 53-40 in the battle for third, while Richmond’s Hugh Boyd Trojans tripped the Pinetree Timberwolves 67-47 in the consolation final. Cloverdale’s Lord Tweedsmuir Panthers slipped past the Centennial Centaurs 66-56 to stay out of the basement.
In Thursday’s semifinals, Turell Scott and Zach Usherwood drained 18 and 16 points respectively but the Gleneagle Talons were tripped 68-47 by the Cougars.
North Vancouver’s Argyle Pipers beat Burnaby’s Byrne Creek Bulldogs 67-57 in the other semi.
In consolation-side action Thursday, Pinetree thumped their cross-Coquitlam rival, Centennial, 82-55, while Hugh Boyd handled Tweedsmuir 61-42.
Usherwood of Gleneagle was chosen to the tournament all-star team, along with Nick Ottenbreit and John Neves, both of Argyle, Byrne Creek’s Ken George and Pavez Jhaj of Enver Creek.
Marc Mincieli of the winning Cougars was named MVP.

이번 교육은 무안군의 양파브랜드 명성을 � 지하� 연작장해를 해결 하여 품질좋은 양파를 생산하기 위해 마� �되었으며, 교육을 통해 양 파 육묘에서 수확까지 � � 과� �에 대하여 지금까지 농가에서 하� 있 는 재배기� 의 문� �� �과 개� 대책을 � �시하여 땅을 살리� 연작으로 발생되는 병해충 피해 최소화로 � 품질 양파생산은 물� 일손을 � �감하는 일석삼조의 효과를 기대하� 있다. 군 관계자에 따르면 ″양파땅살리기 교육은 2∼3년간 농업기� 센터 에서 실시하였던 실증시험을 바탕으로 현장 � 로기� 과 독농가들의 사례를 중심으로 추진되며 양파는 물� 다른 작목에서도 재배기� 을 활용� 수 있어 농작물재배의 새로운 이� �표를 � �시하는 실용화교육 으로서 품질 좋은 농산물을 생산하� 소비자의 욕구를 충족시키는 양파생산으로 경쟁� �을 높힐 수 있을 것″이라� 말했다. (끝)

description.hltext_display: Mid Oaks buys packaging firm PPT
description.content:
BUFFALO GROVE, ILL. (Dec. 21, 12:40 p.m. ET) -- Packaging converter Plastic Packaging Technologies LLC has been purchased by private equity firm Mid Oaks Investments LLC of Buffalo Grove. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
According to a Dec. 21 news release from PPT and Mid Oaks, PPT’s current management, led by President and CEO David Staker and Executive Vice President Dan Staker, will continue leading the business.
“PPT prides itself on providing innovative, high-quality products using the best technology available. With Mid Oaks as our new owners, we will have additional resources at our disposal to help PPT grow to the next level,” David Staker said in the release.
PPT was previously owned by Stonehenge Partners Inc. of Columbus, Ohio, and Tech Investments LLC of Kansas City, Mo. PPT was advised on the sale by Chicago-based investment firm Blaige & Co. LLC.
“We found Stonehenge for [PPT] in 2004 when they did their first deal. Stonehenge provided the impetus to propel [PPT] forward; [PPT] has grown their business two- or three-fold,” Blaige & Co. President Tom Blaige said in a Dec. 21 telephone interview. “Mid Oaks is going to propel them forward even more.”
Blaige said PPT is working to reach $200 million to $300 million in sales and to become the supplier of choice for value-added flexible packaging.
PPT is known for printed and laminated substrates which are then converted into flexible packaging pouches, as well as some secondary capabilities.
“It's not enough just to produce an attractively-printed stand-up pouch. You have to work with the customer to make sure you add the right functionality —sliders, spouts, tear-off scoring, etc. — which will support product growth and attract repeat purchases,” David Staker said.
The company’s capabilities include printing, gusseting, solvent-less adhesive lamination, high-speed slitting, pouch making and converting.
PPT employs about 200 and operates Kansas City, Kan., and Columbus, Ohio, production facilities totaling 175,000 square feet of manufacturing space.
“As a leading, vertically-integrated manufacturer of flexible packaging products for the food, pet food, specialty consumer and health care industries, PPT is an ideal addition to our portfolio,” Wayne Kocourek, chairman CEO of Mid Oaks, said in the release.
Mid Oak’s other plastics-related holding is D&W Fine Pack, a manufacturer of thermoformed plastic and aluminum food packaging in Fountain Inn, S.C.

description.hltext_display: Xmas Express ride two wins into break
description.content:
Austin Carroll (25) of the Coquitlam Express cuts to the net around a Quesnel Millionaires defenceman Friday during a BCHL game at the Sports Centre.
Craig Hodge/The Tri-City News
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
BC North
Updated: December 21, 2010 1:48 PM
Coquitlam Express may have only defeated the two worst teams in the B.C. Hockey League back-to-back but it sure beat losing to them.
The Jr. ‘A’ Express followed up their 7-4 romp Wednesday over the Prince George Spruce Kings win another victory Friday at the Sports Centre, a 4-2 doubling of the Quesnel Millionaires.
The wins boosted the Express to 14-15-1-8 –– the 8 being a league-high overtime losses –– and gave them eight of a possible 10 points in their last five games.
“All in all, there are more good signs than bad as [we] head for the Christmas break,” Express assistant coach Grant Kerr wrote on the team’s website.
The Express return to action next Tuesday when the Alberni Valley Bulldogs, who currently share seventh spot with the Express in the eight-team Coastal Conference, pay at visit, 7 p.m.
After thumping a Prince George team that has mustered a mere seven wins in 41 games, they Express came out and shut down the Millionaires, owners of 10 victories in 38 outings.
Coquitlam native Michael Krgovich led the victors with two goals and one assist to garner first-star status.
Malcolm McKinney and Mark Begert also struck net for the Express.

description.content:
� �남도, 22일 SK D&D 등 5개 기업과 940억 규모 투자협약 � �라남도가 역� � 추진하� 있는 서남해안 관광� �� �도시 개발사업과 � �남의 비교우위 자원을 활용한 � 재생에너지, 친환경 농수축산물 � 부가 가치화 � �책이 구체� �인 투자� 치 성과로 나타나� 있다. � �남도는 22일 오후 3시 도청 서재필실에서 박준영 도지사와 이명� 장흥군수와 SK D&D 등 5개 기업 대표가 참석한 가운데 940억원 규모의 투자협약을 체결했다.
투자협약을 체결한 SK D&D(대표 박주� )는 서남해안관광� �� �도시 구성지구 11만5천㎡ 부지에 600억원을 투자해 단지형 시니어 빌리지 500세대를 건립한다.
한양·보성건설과 공동 출자해 기존 콘크리트 구조에서 탈피, 목조 및 스틸 등 다양한 소재를 이용해 경� �성·친환경성·가변성을 모두 겸비한 단지형 빌리지를 조성 분양� 예� �이어서 서남해안 관광� �� �도시 조성사업 활성화가 기대된다. 한국� 벨(대표 장호성)은 영암 대불산단 2만5천㎡ 부지에 219억원을 투자해 호이스트 크� �인을 � �작한다. 산업용 호이스트 분야 국가 NEP(New Excellent Product, � � �품인증� �도) 인증을 업계 최초로 획득한 기업으로 국내 최초로 600톤 대용량 턴오버 겸용 DB그라브를 개발 실용화했다. � �남도내 조� 기자재업체 발� �과 조� 산업의 경쟁� �을 높일 것으로 예상된다. 두남켐텍(대표 김두한)은 광양 � 금지역의 2천㎡ 부지에 50억원을 투자하여 냉장� 등 � �자� �품과 자동차의 사출 성형물 생산에 필요한 플라스틱 수지에 배합하여 색깔을 내는 착색안료를 생산� 계획이다. 이 회사는 여수 GS 칼텍스에서 원료를 공급받아 � �품을 생산하여 기아자동차, 삼성� �자 등에 납품� 예� �에 있어 � �남 동부지역의 � 휴인� � 흡수 및 � 용을 통해 지역발� �과 소득증대에 기여� 것으로 기대된다. 지솔라(대표 박영준)는 영암 대불자� 무역지역 표준형공장에 48억원을 투자해 태양광발� � 모듈 생산설비를 설치해 연간 10MW의 태양광발� �모듈을 생산해 미국 동남아 등에 수출� 계획이다. 태양� �지 모듈과 관� �된 3건의 특허를 가진 기업으로 국산 원재료 비중을 높이� � 효율 태양� �지 생산을 계획하� 있어 � �남 � 재생에너지 산업분야 발� �에 기여� � �망이다. 해오름농업회사법인(대표 이연주)은 장흥읍 1만㎡ 부지에 23억원을 투자해 친환경 막걸리 생산시설 및 � �통주 체험장 등을 조성한다. 막걸리 산업 활성화와 지역 관광자원 확보 등에 기여� 것으로 기대된다. 투자협약을 체결한 5개 기업은 � �남도가 역� �� �으로 추진하� 있는 서남해안 관광� �� �도시 개발, � 재생에너지 그리� 친환경 식품분야 등에 투자하는 기업으로 � �남지역의 비교우위 자원을 산업화하� � �남지역에서 생산되는 친환경 농산물을 � 부가가치화해 지역발� �은 물� 일자리 창출에 크게 기여� 것으로 기대된다. 박준영 도지사는 투자협약식에서 "� �남이 미래 � �략산업으로 집중 육성하� 있는 분야에서 기� � �과 연구개발 능� � 등 성장 � 재� �이 큰 기업이 투자하게 돼 지역 발� �에 기대가 크다"며 "� �남을 대표하는 기업으로 성장� 수 있도록 행·재� �� � 지원에 최� 을 다하� 다"� 약속했다. (끝) 출처 : � �라남도청 본 콘텐� 는 해당기관의 보도자료임을 밝혀드립니다.

description.hltext_display: � �남도, 관광문화산업 기반 대폭 늘린다
description.content: 내년 섬·녹색관광자원 개발 등 3천168억 예산 투입...올해보다 32% 늘어 � �라남도는 생태녹색·문화관광개발사업 등 관광문화 산업기반 확충을 통해 지역경� � 활성화를 견인하기 위해 내년도 관광문화 분야 예산을 대폭 확대, 3천168억원을 투입키로 했다� 22일 밝혔다. 이는 올해보다 32% 늘어난 것으로 � �남도가 가진 세계� � 수준의 섬·해양 자원과 맑은 공기, 깨끗한 물 및 청� �한 땅 등 천혜의 자원을 활용해 해양 및 생태관광산업의 메카로 발돋움하� 자 하는 박준영 도지사의 의지를 담은 것이다. 이에 따라 내년도 관광문화 분야 역� � 추진 업무를 � 택과 집중을 통한 섬·해양자원 개발로 파급효과 극대화, 중국인 대상 서남해안 낙조 특화상품 등 다양하� 특색있는 관광상품 개발을 통한 국내외 관광객 � 치, 관광숙박 등 민간 투자� 치를 통한 관광산업 활성화, � �소득층을 위한 문화바우처 사업지원, 문화콘텐� 산업 육성, � �� �스포� 활성화를 통한 � �� �산업 강화 등으로 � �하� 모� 역량을 집중� 계획이다. � �남� 는 올 한해 관광인프라 구축, 관광상품 개발, 지역문화 예� 의 창작활동 기반조성, � �국 규모의 다양한 스포� 대회와 이벤트로 스포� 산업 활성화에 기여하는 등 지역경� � 활성화에 심혈을 기울였다. 그 결과 2010 명량대첩축� �에 국내외 관광객 32만명이 방문한 것을 비롯해 남도명품 1박2일 계� �상품(70여종), 남도예� 은행 � 요경매(2천299� �), 도립국악단 � 요공연(310회) 운영, 그리� 동계� �지훈� �(55만명) � 치를 통해 557억원의 경� �효과를 거뒀다. 특히 � �남도는 이를 통해 도민들에게 � 수 있다는 자� 감과 함께 잘 살 수 있다는 희망의 메시지를 심어준 것으로 평가하� 있다. 영광에서 H여행사를 운영하는 홍일성(59) 대표는 "� 진국으로 갈수록 여행은 � 택이 아니라 필수항목이다. � �남도가 어� �운 재� � 여건에서도 관광을 � �략산업의 한 축으로 인식하� 관� � 예산을 대폭 반영한 것은 � 무� �"이라며 "격화되는 국내외 지역간 발� � 경쟁에서 � �남이 살아남기 위해서는 관광객 � 치를 통해 관광산업의 � 대를 확보하는 것이 관건"이라� 강조했다. 양복완 � �남도 관광문화국장은 "관광은 � 용을 창출하� 돈이 되는 굴뚝 없는 � 부가가치 산업"이라며 "관광산업의 발� �은 단순히 관광인프라 확충이나 업계의 노� �만으로 이뤄지는 것이 아닌 만큼 모� 도민이 친� �하� 따뜻한 말씨와 배� �하는 마음으로 � �남을 찾는 외지인을 맞이하는 참여가 � �실하다"� 당부했다. (끝) 출처 : � �라남도청 본 콘텐� 는 해당기관의 보도자료임을 밝혀드립니다.

description.hltext_display: Cats' owner peeks in on his hot squad
description.content:
Precisely one week after undergoing double-bypass surgery, Ron Luniw was released from hospital last Wednesday. Three days later, he followed his heart and visited his favourite spot –– the hockey rink.
“I snuck out,” conceded the Port Moody Black Panthers owner and GM Luniw, who was thrilled to watch his team collect its third straight win via a 3-1 triumph Saturday over the Grandview Steelers at PoMo Rec Complex. “I stood in the corner and watched. It was pretty exciting.”
The Cats are arguably the Pacific International Jr. ‘B’ league’s hottest team, having cooked up seven wins in their last nine outings. They improved to 14-11-4 and sit a mere three points behind the Harold Brittain Conference-leading Abbotsford Pilots.
With his team burning it up, Luniw realizes he must be sure not to allow himself to over-heat.
“They [doctors] told me the only thing I can do is walk, and that’s very little,” said the 60-year-old Luniw, who’s in his 11th season as boss of the Black Panthers, formerly the PoCo Buckeroos. “[Heart surgery] beats you up a bit, all right. It’s not tonsillitis, put it that way. If you think you’re going to wake up [after] and everything’s normal, you’re fooling yourself.”
The Cats led 2-1 after the first period and closed out the scoring with less than two minutes to go in the second when Brandon Millin netted a shorthanded tally. The game was a rugged affair that featured 138 penalty minutes. Yet the Cats’ kept their cool when it most mattered, killed off all nine Grandview powerplay chances and merrily nabbed the two points.
“They players are really buying into what [head coach] Ron [Johnson] is instructing them to do,” Luniw said.
Maximilian Fiedler and Joel Hamilton sandwiched goals around that of the Grandview’s Kyle Golz, who was the lone Steeler to beat Cats’ keeper Nicholas Taylor, who blocked 40 shots. Hamilton’s game winner was the centre’s 14th goal of the season as the 20-year-old PoCo product leads the Cats with 30 points in 28 games.
The Cats were set to host the 10-16-3 Mission Icebreakers last night (Tuesday, after The News’ deadline) before the Christmas break. They then embark on a three-game road swing before returning home to host the Pilots on Jan. 8.

description.hltext_display: 微软紧急召回Outlook问题补丁 360称可一键修复
《非2》姚晨清新自然 丢掉幻想才能真正包容
description.author: sohu.com
description.content:
搜狐娱乐讯 “子弹”还飞着，电影《非诚勿扰2》 电影《非诚勿扰2》除了延续了上一部秦奋（葛优饰演）和笑笑（舒淇饰演）的故事脉络外，又新加入了芒果（姚晨饰演）和李香山（孙红雷饰演）这对夫妻的感情故事，其中两人创意十足的离婚典礼成为了影片中的最大亮点。这场看似荒诞不经却庄严神圣、礼数周全的仪式，让观众爆笑不已，然而两人醉后难舍难分的拥吻告别，以及芒果那句“别给新认识的人花太多钱”的最后祝福，又让人看得悲从心来。
今年姚晨在大银幕上表现很活跃，先后有四部作品与观众见面，在经历了《摇摆de婚约》和《爱出色》这类时尚电影后，姚晨在《非诚勿扰2》中表现得更为自然从容。冯小刚 在谈到芒果这个角色以及这部影片时，姚晨说：“《非2》的信息量更大，《非1》更多地局限于笑笑与秦奋的爱情纠葛，而这一部中更多地去思索婚姻、探讨人生，其中有很多让我觉得很经典的台词，比如剧本中有一句‘丢掉幻想才能做到真正的包容’，其实这句话可能很多人并不是特别理解，但我相信有婚姻的人、或者愿意选择婚姻的人，对这句话会有更深的感悟，还是应该区分幻想与梦想之间的区别吧，这部戏保留了梦想，丢掉了幻想。”
上搜狐微博 与明星对话

description.hltext_display: Gunter to join Wolves
description.content:
The WolfPack has announced the commitment of 17-year-old right side Brad Gunter of the G.P. Vanier Towhees. His team finished fifth in the recent B.C. AAA Provincial championships. Gunter was recently chosen by The Province newspaper as the top high school boys volleyball player in B.C.
Says coach Hennelly: “Brad is as good as Gord Perrin coming out of high school. He is similar size 6’7” and has a similar spike jump 11’4’. Brad can both set and play right side (he is a lefty) and has very good skills and size. He was chosen by all three CIS coaches in B.C. as the top high school player and I feel honoured that he has chosen TRU from the many school, that were recruiting him,”Hennelly said.
“Brad played for Brian McAskill at G.P. Vanier. I coached Brad this summer on Team BC and I was equally impressed by his selfless play and work ethic as I was by his athletic abilities. Brad will be an impact player in the Canada West and CIS and it is a great Christmas present for our program that he chose TRU for his post-secondary career. We want to continue to recruit the best athletes from the province and Brad is another great recruit for the WolfPack.”
McAskill says Gunter is a talent. “As a coach, Brad is a once-in-a-career player. He is so talented he looks like a man playing with boys at the high school level even though he just turned 17 in early December. His obvious physical gifts (size, strength and quickness) are enhanced even more by his ability to control his mental game.
“He is very level headed. and eases his teammates particularly in pressure situations. He is the only player that I have coached with the ability to lead his team as both an attacker and a setter. He recently took his team to the brink of the AAA high school semifinals even though he was unable to attack the ball due to a bone fracture in his leg.”
Gunter’s talent is appreciated by other Canada West coaches such as Ben Josephson at Trinity Western University in Langley. “Brad is one of the most complete players that we have seen in B.C. high school for
quite some time. In baseball, they talk about a five-tool player. Bradis the volleyball equivalent. He blocks, serves, passes, sets and attacks at an elite level. To find such a well-balanced skill set on a 6’7” athlete with explosive jump, agility and foot speed is extremely rare. Add an explosive left arm, and you have an extremely
special athlete, one that we have not seen in this province for quite some time. Brad will be a great success for many years to come in this sport.”
Gunter spurned offers from UBC and UBCO to commit to the WolfPack where he plans to take courses in the Bachelor of Science. He believes his strengths are being the “go to” guy on the court.
Will he had a tough time moving to the nation’s top level of
volleyball? McAskill doesn’t think so. “I believe Brad will be
successful at the CIS level due to youth and ability to thrive under CIS like coaching situations. I am a demanding high school coach who has coached at the college level and I think this and the fact that Brad has
played for coach Hennelly last summer on TEAM BC will prepare him for the CIS Level.
“It is clear that he has the physical gifts to play right
away at the CIS level, his mental capabilities should allow him to balance the demands of playing CIS volleyball for a demanding coach while completing university studies.”
Instead of working out with his new teammates this summer, Gunter will be training in Kamloops as part of Team BC competing in the 2011 Western Canada Summer Games.

(끝) 출처 : � �라남도청 본 콘텐� 는 해당기관의 보도자료임을 밝혀드립니다.

description.hltext_display: Orcas win four at Tournament for Emily
description.content:
Elgin Park’s Sandy Hsu drives past a Gleneagle Talons’ defender last Friday, during the Tournament for Emily in Port Coquitlam.
Jennifer Gauthier photo
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
BC North
Updated: December 21, 2010 2:33 PM
With a new round-robin style format – with no playoff rounds – there was no clear winner at last weekend's Tournament for Emily in Port Coquitlam.
But the Elgin Park Orcas senior girls basketball team still was won of just two teams to go undefeated, reeling off four straight wins.
The Orcas, 14th in provincial triple-A girls rankings, opened with a 71-59 win over eighth-ranked Centennial, and followed that with Day 2 victories over the Gleneagle Talons, 68-44, and Terry Fox, 51-27. On the third and final day of the tournament, Elgin Park edged No. 10 Kelowna 64-62.
"We played really well (against Centennial), and even though we didn't shoot particularly well, we still managed to score," said Elgin Park coach Stu Graham.
"The next day, we didn't play nearly as well, but we won both games and that's the most important thing – that we beat the teams we're supposed to beat."
Sandy Hsu led Elgin in scoring against Centennial, with 22 points, while Stacey Graham had 17 and Natalie Hadiken 13, including seven in the fourth quarter.
The only other team to win all its games was the host Riverside Rapids, who were on the other side of the tourney bracket from Elgin Park.
In addition to the four tournament wins, the Orcas also won a league-game Tuesday over Seaquam, and – coupled with wins in their final two games at the HSBC tournament earlier this month – are now on a seven-game win streak.
"We're putting a little stretch together… it's good. We're up and down, but we're getting better," Graham said.
TEXT

description.hltext_display: Sheriff's office to get south Bibb location
New Fiction Release Features Murder and Mayhem in a Small Massachusetts Town; Book by Paul F. Jopling, Released by Dog Ear Publishing
description.author: Dog Ear Publishing
description.content: --(PR.com)-- Detective Lou Simansky hoped that his life in Gossett Mills would be peaceful and quiet. Unfortunately, the discovery of two dead bodies dims his expectations. The deceased, Molly Simms and Jethro Clayton, made an unlikely duoMolly was an elderly eccentric recluse, while Jethro was the town manager. What were these two people doing together, and why were they killed in cold blood? Two rare old coins found on Claytons body provide the only clues, setting off a chain of events that will rock the small town to its core. Simansky is assisted in his investigation by his former colleague and criminalist, Rod Hedtler, now a software-company CEO with an eye for the ladies, especially the attractive young town manager pro tem, Erica Bartel.When Simansky and Hedtler search Jethro Claytons computer for possible motives for his murder, they stumble upon a most fascinating documenta letter from a disgruntled Hessian mercenary that essentially provides a treasure map leading to a missing chest of valuable coins. Consequently, when the community learns of this potential windfall more bodies start to turn up and Simansky becomes increasingly bewildered in his attempt to put all the pieces together. Will Simansky find the murderer, or murderers, before more people die? Is there actually a treasure to be found? Will Gossett Mills ever return to its original tranquil milieu?The Hessian Hoax, published by Dog Ear Publishing, is a fascinating thriller with many surprising twists and turns and characters with real depth. It is Paul F. Joplings second novel. Jopling was a writing consultant, writing sales training literature, marketing brochures, and product and system descriptions for large companies such as AT&T Bell Laboratories, MITs Instrumentation Laboratory, NEC, and Hewlett Packard Corporation. At Northeastern University, he earned his Bachelors degree in Business Administration and an Associate Degree in Electronics Engineering and also fulfilled his undergraduate requirements for a degree in Psychology.For more information, visit www.pauljoplingbooks.comThe Hessian HoaxPaul F. JoplingDog Ear PublishingISBN: 978-159858-873-6 254 pages $22.95 USAvailable at Ingram, Amazon.com, Barnes & Noble and fine bookstores everywhereAbout Dog Ear Publishing, LLC Dog Ear Publishing offers completely customized self-publishing services for independent authors. We provide cost-effective, fast, and highly profitable services to publish and distribute independently published books. Our book publishing and distribution services reach worldwide. Dog Ear authors retain all rights and complete creative control throughout the entire self-publishing process. Self-publishing services are available globally at www.dogearpublishing.net and from our offices in Indianapolis, Indiana.Dog Ear Publishing self-publishing that actually makes sense.###Detective Lou Simansky hoped his life in Gossett Mills would be peaceful and quiet. Unfortunately, the discovery of two dead bodies dims his expectations. The deceased, Molly Simms and Jethro Clayton, made an unlikely duoMolly was an elderly eccentric recluse, while Jethro was town manager. What were these two people doing together, and why were they killed? Two rare old coins found on Claytons body provide the only clues, setting off a chain of events that will rock the small town.

description.hltext_display: 테스� 사� 리스 외국 사례-⑬ 오스트리아
description.content:
사� 리스로 � �통과 현대의 조화를 이룬 오스트리아 � �빵 공장-매장 등 � � 공� � 온습도 관리가 만� � � 한 빵 오스트리아에서 � �과 및 � �빵 산업 시장을 크게 장악하� 있으며, 온 국민의 사랑을 듬뿍 받� 있는 � �빵기업 Strock bakeries(Headquarters and stores)은 � � �한 위생관리와 더불어 가장 맛있는 � �통 빵이라는 브랜드로 � 명하다. 1970년 10명의 종업원으로 시작한 Strock bakeries는 현재 1,000명 이상의 종업원과 60개 이상의 매장을 소� 한 식품 대기업으로 성장했으며, 이 기업은 현재 � 행하는 � �빵뿐만 아니라 � �통 방식의 빵과 패스트리, 케이크, � 키를 � �조하여 판매하거나 공급하여 더욱 � 명해� �서 매장을 찾는 사람들의 발길이 끊이지 않는다. 공장에서 만� 완� �품은 본사에서 슈퍼마켓에 직� � 공급하며, 반� �품은 본사에서 각 매장으로 보내 완� �품으로 완성하여 판매하� 하도록 하는데, 그� 생산한 빵은 대부분 당일에 모두 판매되� 있어 항상 � � 함을 � 지하� 있다. 그러나 생산 과� �과 완� �품을 판매하는 직영매장의 보관 환경에 의해서 가끔씩 사소한 맛의 변질이 발생하기도 했다. 바로 작은 환경변화에 의해서 쉽게 오르내리는 온습도 때문이었다. 그래서 가장 먼� � 세운 대책이 여러 형태의 보관실을 용도에 맞는 최� �의 온도로 관리되� 있는지 감시하는 일이었다. 그래서 10m³ 규모에 -20°C를 � 지해야 하는 두 개의 냉동실과 2∼8°C 사이를 � 지해야 하는 냉장실, 매장에는 손님을 위해 � �과와 � �빵을 진열한 7개의 카운터 관리를 우� 시작하� , 차츰 생산공� �까지 확대� 계획을 세� 다. 그러나 모� 보관실과 매장과 함께 생산 � � 공� �에 각자의 온습도계를 설치하여 일일이 관찰하� 관리하는 일이란 너무나 번거로운 일이었다. 그래서 모� 환경을 한자리에서 한꺼번에 편리하게 감시� 수 있는 테스� 사� 리스를 설치하였다. 컨버터 하나와 T1D 7개와 T3D 3개를 설치하여 여러 곳에서 발생하는 다양한 데이터를 � 르게 � 이스로 수집해 나갔다. 특히 이미 설치되어 있는 VPN 통� 망을 활용� 수 있어서 데이터 관리는 더욱 수월했다.
Strock bakeries 시설 관리자는 "맛과 더불어 � � 함을 � �1의 원칙으로 하여 만� 브랜드라는 이미지를 만들어 준 시스템이다. 사� 리스로 관리한 이후 단골 � 객과 매출량이 급속하게 증가하� 있다"며 "우리가 생산한 � �품을 관리� 수 있도록 앞으로 모� 매장에도 설치� 계획이다"� 밝혔다. 건축, 식품, 문화재, 의료 등 많은 분야에서 체계� �인 온습도 관리를 � �실하게 필요로 하� 있다. 지금까지 온습도 관리가 쾌� �한 생활을 누리기 위함이었다면, 앞으로는 인류와 역사, 문화와 환경의 생명 연장과 지구 살리기라는 보다 큰 차원으로 향하� 있다. 끊임없이 변화 발� �해 온 50년 � �통의 테스� . 독일의 � �밀한 기� � �은 테스� 사� 리스로 태어났� , 세계� �인 다양한 기업이 온습도 관리를 위해 사� 리스를 설치하여 첨단기� 을 누리� 있다. 세계가 인� �한 테스� 의 측� � 기� 이 인류의 생명과 건강을 위해 다른 나라에서는 어떻게 사용되� 있는지 연재를 통해 소개하� 있다. � 스웨덴 - 테스� 사� 리스, UMAS를 사로잡다 ② 이탈리아 - 지중해 온습도 속 의료환경, 테스� 사� 리스로 '쾌� �!' ③ 이란 - 사� 리스, � �약� 통의 네트워크가 되다 ④ 호주 - 호주인의 주치의, 테스� 사� 리스 시스템 ⑤ 스페인 - 곡류의 무한 용병, 테스� 사� 리스 ⑥ 중국 - 아스트라� �네카는 말한다. "먼� � 테스� 를 알라!" ⑦ 영국 - 과일의 � � 한 보호막 '테스� 사� 리스' ⑧ 독일 - 사� 리스와 함께 미래로 가는 인류의 문화� 산 ⑨ 네덜란드 - � �조 산업의 혁� � �인 � 호, 테스� 사� 리스 ⑩ 스위스 - 최상급 육가공 � �장-판매-관리까지, 사� 리스로 한자리에서 '척척' ⑪ 프랑스 - 식품 산업의 불로초, 테스� 사� 리스 ⑫ 벨기에 - 사� 리스와 함께하는 벨기에의 맛 Debailleul 초콜릿 ⑬ 오스트리아 - 사� 리스로 � �통과 현대의 조화를 이룬 오스트리아 � �빵 ⑭ 한국 - 국내 의약 � �장의 최첨단 자동화를 이룬 사� 리스 (끝) 출처 : 테스� 코리아 본 콘텐� 는 해당기관의 보도자료임을 밝혀드립니다.

description.hltext_display: ANC's 'Tease' lists top 10 moments of the year
description.author: ANC
description.content:
MANILA, Philippines - ANC's new lifestyle show Tease looks back at 2010 and cites its top 10 moments of the year.
Here they are:
10. Jejemons
Love them or hate them, the latest evolution of the societal gene pool has influenced everything -- from movies to music, shows, news, the Internet, and even our language itself.
How long they'll be around is anyone's guess, but now they've got a place in our culture, like them or not.
9. iPad
Apple's dominance of our portable lives just took a step farther.
The must-have gadget of the year, Apple's iPad, did not make an entrance just to make our socializing and communication better. No, it ushered in the biggest gamut of casual gamers the world has ever seen.
If the iPad is good for anything, it's games.
8. PCOS machine
Social media has been hitting in stride lately but the PCOS machine proved how fun the elections could be.
Not only was it a less boring way to keep up with the elections, it showed that we're just scratching the surface in terms of what we can do with social media that aren't retweets or mass mobilizations.
7. Conan vs. Leno
If you must ask, we're Team Coco. The wait for Conan's eventual return to TV was excruciating, though.
6. Urbandub at 10
Ten awesome years for an awesome band. Besides, we like it when people we like succeed.
5. Large Hadron Collider
While searching for the God particles, 3 things did not happen -- inter-dimensional rift to a hostile alien world, time travel, and most important, the world did not end.
So science, we salute you. Keep up all the crazy things you do.
4. Inception
Love it or hate it, Inception did one thing -- it made everyone (your mom, your dad, your grandma, grandpa, kid, sister and dog) talk about it.
For the first time in a good long while, everyone was talking about a high-concept film.
3. Philippine cinema
Philippine cinema hasn't been gaining momentum over a very long period, but this year we saw it spike a bit.
Awesome indie releases, more festivals than you can shake a stick at, and mainstream surprises have actually made it a good year for cinema. We could only hope that this continues on to next year.
2. The last NU Rock Awards
Despite the melancholic undertones, the last NU Rock Awards were totally awesome.
Stellar performances and a sense of nostalgia pumped up the music all the way to 11. We'd rather not go to the sad things, it was a celebration of everything we loved about music and the station itself.
1. Tease
Of course, Tease is number one. For 13 straight weeks, we've brought you a little slice of heaven.
And all our lives have become a little better since we went on air. You're welcome.
Watch Tease on ANC (SkyCable Channel 27) every Tuesday, 9:30 p.m. with replays on Wednesdays, 3:00 p.m.

11وثيقة تعاون و7 مشروعات مشتركة حصيلة الاجتماع الثاني لمجلس التعاون الاستراتيجي عالي المستوى بين سورية وتركيا.. زيادة حجم التبادل التجاري ليصل إلى 5 مليارات دولار

رياضة>> 22 كانون الأول, 2010
دمشق-سانا
فاز فريق الجيش على ضيفه الكرامة 71-60 في المباراة التي جمعتهما أمس باستكمال منافسات المرحلة الثامنة من دوري المحترفين للرجال بكرة السلة وفي المباراة الثانية فاز الاتحاد على جاره الحرية في حلب 64-54.
ففي المباراة الاولى التي جمعت الجيش مع الكرامة في صالة نادي دوما الرياضي تمكن الجيش من حسم اللقاء لصالحه ليعود إلى صدارة ترتيب الفرق برصيد 14 نقطة مشتركا مع الجلاء الذي فاز أمس على قاسيون بالرصيد ذاته علما بان الفريقين حققا حتى الآن 7 انتصارات متتالية دون ان يتعرضا لأي خسارة.
وفي المباراة الثانية تمكن الاتحاد من العودة إلى سكة الانتصارات من بوابة جاره الحرية بعد الخسارة في المرحلة الماضية مع الجلاء ليحسن مركزه على سلم الترتيب.
وانتهى الربع الاول من المباراة بتسجيل ضعيف لكلا الفريقين وبواقع 10-7 لصالح الاتحاد وتحسن الاداء الهجومي في الربع الثاني من المباراة الذي انهاه الاتحاد لصالحه 25-18.
وعاب التسرع الربع الثالث من اللقاء ولاسيما في الناحية الهجومية التي لم يوفق فيها الفريقان في انهاء الكرات داخل السلة لينتهي الربع لصالح الاتحاد 10-8 ورغم تقدم الحرية في الربع الاخير للمباراة 21-19 الا ان ذلك لم يكن كافيا لتعويض فارق الارباع الثلاثة ليعلن الحكم نهاية المباراة بفوز الاتحاد بفارق 10 نقاط وبواقع 64-54.
وكانت المرحلة الثامنة أقيمت أول أمس وشهدت فوز الوحدة على ضيفه الطليعة بفارق 29 نقطة 90-61 والجلاء على ضيفه قاسيون 98-67 والوثبة على محردة 90-58 واليرموك على النواعير 76-51.

description.hltext_display: Tournament Capital briefs
description.content:
South Kam Titan Hailey Sigalet, middle, battles with two Barriere Cougar defenders on Wednesday, Dec. 15, in Fulton Cup action at the Tournament Capital Centre.
Dave Eagles/KTW
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
BC North
Updated: December 21, 2010 2:47 PM
•Titans, Sabres golden at Fulton Cup
In the Fulton Cup girls’ final, the Titans disposed of the Sa-Hali Sabres 84-24. Emma Wolfram led the Titans in scoring with 21 points, while Nicole Karstein netted seven for the Sabres. In the boys’ final, Sa-Hali topped the NorKam Saints 97-89. Connor Dolson racked up 34 points for the Sabres. Harley Mireau scored 30 for the Saints. Both finals were played on Friday, Dec. 17.
•Thompson to curl at Scotties
There is just one Kamloops entry at the 2011 Scotties BC Women’s Curling Championship.
Karla Thompson’s Kamloops Curling Club rink is the lone Tournament Capital representative.
She’s ranked eighth head into the tournament.
Defending champion Kelly Scott’s Kelowna rink is the top seed, followed by New Westminster’s Kelley Law and Richmond’s Kristy Lewis.
The 2011 Scotties are slated to run Jan. 17 to Jan. 23 at the Cloverdale Curling Club.
•Pond hockey tourney in Vernon
Registration is now open for a pond-hockey tournament taking place outside Vernon next year.
The 2011 Pond Hockey Championships are slated to run Feb. 3 to Feb. 6 at Silver Star Ski Resort.
Organizers are hoping for a strong turnout and have already registered teams from as far away as Edmonton and Washington state.
Games will be four-on-four with traditional backyard rules — no offsides, no icing and no goalies.
There are men’s, women’s and co-ed divisions, and recreational and competitive divisions within each of those.
Players must be 19 years of age.
Registration is $550 per team.
To sign up or for more information, go online to pinkpuck.ca.
•Sun Peaks in full swing
Just about all the ski-able terrain at Sun Peaks is now open.
Over the weekend, spokeswoman Melanie Simmons said 95 per cent of the resort’s terrain is now officially open and the few remaining runs are expected to follow shortly.
The West Bowl T-Bar and the Burfield Chairlift also opened late last week, meaning all chairlifts on Sun Peaks’ three mountains are now operational.
The resort is also teaming up with a Chase-based helicopter company to offer a different view of the mountains.
Sun Peaks and Lakehead Helicopters are now operating two separate aerial tours — one of Sun Peaks and McGillivvray Lake and the other of the Adams River-Shuswap area.
The Sun Peaks tour is $140, while the Shuswap tour is $320.
•Big League camp in Kamloops
McArthur Island will be busier than usual this summer, as an Okanagan-based baseball company is bringing some of its camps and tournaments to the River City.
Big League Experience will host two Mizuno specialty camps and six tournaments on McArthur Island in 2011.
BLE will host Best of the West, Can-Am, Futures and Showcase tournaments on various weekends from March through September, and its high-performance camps will run in the late summer.
The Kamloops Minor Baseball Association is also gearing up for its 2011 registration drive.
Registration for the 2011 season will take place on Feb. 12, Feb. 19 and Feb. 26 at the McArthur Island Sports Centre.
Winter baseball clinics are also slated to begin next month, for rookie ball and mini-tad players right up to bantams and midgets.
The camps take place in the gyms of area schools.
For more information on the BLE, season registration or the winter clinics, visit kamloopsminorbaseball.com.
•Pack in hunt at break
Pat Hennelly and the Thompson Rivers University WolfPack men’s volleyball team are in the midst of a rebuilding year.
Still, as they enter the 2010-2011 Christmas break, the WolfPack are in the hunt for a playoff spot.
The youthful Pack, with no player on its roster with more than two years of Canadian Interuniversity Sports (CIS) experience, sit in fifth place in the Canada West with a 3-5 record.
“It has been a long first half with some great growth as a team,” Hennelly said.
“We went from a team that struggled in the pre-season to beating two of the top Canada West teams in Manitoba and Trinity Western.”
The WolfPack will play in the Trinity Western Spartans’ holiday season tournament before hosting Dalhousie University in a pair of exhibition matches on Jan. 7 and Jan. 8.
TRU’s first 2011 Canada West match is scheduled for Jan. 14 in Brandon.
Hennelly said he is pleased with his squad’s performance in the first half of the season.
“I am proud of the way the guys have taken the responsibility of keeping the program in the CIS Top Ten. We have less CIS experience than all of the teams that we have faced and all the other TRU teams. We have pushed the guys hard on the court and in the weight room and they have responded.”
TEXT

description.hltext_display: KMHA briefs, Dec. 17 to Dec. 19.
description.content:
Monty Chisholm of the bantam AAA Kamloops Jardine Blazers goes to the backhand during his squad’s 12-0 victory over Vernon on Saturday, Dec. 18, at Memorial Arena.
Dave Eagles/KTW
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
BC North
Updated: December 21, 2010 2:54 PM
•Bantam Blazers roll at home
The bantam AAA Kamloops Jardine Blazers cruised to two home wins on the weekend.
Kamloops topped Vernon 12-0 on Saturday at Memorial Arena.
Lighting the lamp for the Blazers: Joe Hicketts, Carter Cochrane, Monty Chisholm, Ryan Gropp (3), Chad Butcher (3), Carson Bolduc, Mason Harding and Nic Fidanza.
Kyle Michalovsky earned the shutout.
On Sunday, the Blazers hammered Kelowna 6-1 at Memorial.
Chisholm, Butcher (3), Gropp and Mitchell Barker scored for Kamloops in support of winning goaltender Liam McLeod.
•Boom and Thunder clash in tie
The Sandman Blue Thunder skated to a 1-1 tie with the Sandman Sonic Boom on Saturday, Dec. 18, at Valleyview Arena in atom recreation play.
Liam Rose tallied for the Blue Thunder in support of goaltender Riley Moore.
Connor Humphrey rattled the cage for the Sonic Boom.
Josh Humphrey was in net for the Sonic Boom.
•Sharks make meal out of Wings
In atom house action, the Sharks doubled up on the Spicy Chicken Wings, winning the tilt 6-3.
Scoring for the Sharks: Josh Olynyk (3), Rhys Blundell (2) and Matthew Nixon.
Nathan Nesci earned the win between the pipes.
•Lightning strike once in Gamblers win
The female peewee-bantam Lightning were in tough against the peewee Gamblers on Friday at Memorial Arena, losing the game 8-1.
Scoring for the Gamblers: Evan Wynne, Eathan Kasten (3), Tobin Huffman, Keegan Emsland, Matthew Erichuk and Kyle McIlwain.
The Lightning’s only marker came in the third period from Sydney Harris.
•Smooth sailing for Ice Hawks
The Sandman Ice Hawks disposed of the Ice Sharks 9-1 in atom recreation play.
Benjamin Ward potted five goals for the Hawks, while Tyler Standen, Eric Bertuzzi, Thomas Ratuski and Brandon Gramaud added singles.
Elijah Joly was the winning netminder.
Taylor Russell netted the Sharks’ only goal.
•Tigers pounce on Aeros
The Sandman Ice Tigers scraped by the Sandman Aeros 5-2 on Saturday in atom recreation action.
Jordan Swoboda, Jake Tabor, Birch Mierau (2) and A.J. McInnis tallied for the Tigers.
Ryan Clark was the winning netminder.
Ethan Crawford and Andrew Warner scored for the Aeros in a losing cause.
•Bulldogs on track at local tourney
The Timbits Bulldogs posted a 2-0-1 record at an initiation D tournament at McArthur Island Sports Centre on the weekend.
In their first game of the tourney on Saturday, the Bulldogs skated to a 7-2 victory over the Timbits Ice Devils.
Reed Watson (3), Noah Bradley (2), Bailey Monteith and Kyle Sandher netted goals for the Bulldogs.
Ethan Hardy was in net for the win.
Nolan Virgo and Michael Hutchinson scored for the Ice Devils.
•In Game 2, the Bulldogs edged the Black Knights 4-3.
Scoring for the Bulldogs in support of netminder Hardy: Watson (3) and Jacob Proulx.
Ty Haywood-Farmer, Xander Denis and Aidan Sutter scored for the Knights.
On Sunday, Sandher scored late in the game to lift the Bulldogs into a 5-5 tie with the Timbits Bruins.
Bradley scored a hat trick to pace the Bulldogs and Proulx notched a single. Sheehan Tobler was the Bulldogs’ goalie.
Harrison Ewert scored three times to lead the Bruins, who went with Josh Glover in goal. Parker Erickson and Dakota Reid also scored for the Bruins.
•Blackhawks beat Avs
In peewee house action, the Canadian Tire Blackhawks squeezed past the Brock Auto Avalanche 8-5.
Scoring for the Blackhawks: Karn Mahal, Alek Giguere (5), Preston Guerra and Austin Moray.
Lighting the lamp for the Avs: Brayden Jensen, Jake Barron (2), Josh Oldham and Keyron Pavlovich.
Scott Poelzer earned the win between the pipes for the Canadian Tire Blackhawks.
•Spitfires beat royalty
The Kamloops Office System Spitfires earned a 6-2 victory over the ANAVET Kings.
Scoring for the Spitfires: Nolan Dicostanzo, Brenden Bickert, Dimitri Louvros, Blaise Brewer, Trevor Banks and Landon Weiss.
The Kings’ goals came from Kristoffer Borgstrom and Alex Mori.
Recording the win in goal for the Spitfires was Gabe Bedard.
•Depleted midget Lions fight for survival
An injury-plagued midget tier 1 North Shore Lions squad endured a winless weekend.
On Friday, the Lions lost 8-2 to Pursuit of Excellence of Kelowna.
Seamus Benwell scored once in the loss.
On Sunday, the Lions tied Vernon 4-4, thanks in large part to Stu Beckett, Isaac Kaay, Levi Mattes, Kyle Pouncy, Adam Struch and Tyson Witt who filled in for eight injured Kamloops players.
Kaay, Landon MacGillivray and Justin Bartella (2) were the Lions' goal scorers.
•Mystix double up on Kelowna
The female bantam tier 1 Kamloops Scotiabank Mystix defeated a Kelowna squad 2-1 on Sunday.
Kiana Karolyi and Lindsey Rose scored for the Mystix.
Emma Gottfriedson had an outstanding performance in net for Kamloops.
•Warriors take Venom out in Vernon
In atom development play, the LN Group Warriors were in Vernon, where they skated to a 4-3 win over the hometown Venom.
Ryan Chyzowski netted a hat-trick and Kennan Gannon registered a single.
Jarrett Larsen was in net for the win.
•Bantam Lions earn split
The bantam tier 3 North Shore Lions split their weekend games, topping Penticton 7-0 before losing 8-5 to Revelstoke.
Gio Ramunno had a pair of goals against Penticton, with Jackson Scott, Dante Caillier, Tylor Seabrooke, Jordan Clisby and Curtis Ruttan adding singles.
Blake Rose was in the net for the shutout.
Ramunno (2), Brad Neufeld (2) and Keith Comte scored in the loss to Revelstoke.
•Roofing Devils fall to Kelowna
The atom development Western Roofing Devils were on the losing end of a 4-2 scoreline in a game against a squad from Kelowna on Saturday.
Eric Marasco and Breckin Erichuk tallied for the Devils in the loss.
Kelowna outplayed the Devils in the second and third periods.
•Motor Inn boys take to the road
The bantam tier 2 Kamloops Maverick Motor Inn squad played .500 hockey on the weekend.
On Friday, Kamloops lost 5-4 in Kelowna.
Dexter Robinson, Cole Clifford, Cole McCaskill and Joe Falsetta scored for Maverick Motor Inn.
Kamloops won 6-0 in Salmon Arm on Saturday.
Ryan Clifford, C. Clifford, Jordan Passmore (3) and Joe Davis were the goal scorers.
Josh Shank was in net for Kamloops shutout win.
•Midget Mystix magical on weekend
The female midget tier 1 Kamloops Mystix ran away from the female midget Salmon Arm Silvertips on Saturday, winning the tilt 8-0.
Ayla Oppenheim (2), Alexis Gottfriedson, Emily Bailey, Jaclyn Frilund, Jana McNary, Marlie Rittinger and Julie Palmantier scored the Mystix's goals.
On Sunday, the Mystix defeated a female midget Kelowna team 3-2.
Oppenheim and Rittinger each had a goal and an assist with Palmantier scoring in the third period to break the tie.
•Cabinet Warriors breach security
In midget recreation action, Sam's Custom Cabinet Warriors doubled the Ronik Security Black Knights 6-3.
Erik Dube, Carson Bradford and Cole Walters each had a pair for the Warriors.
Mason Cavaliere scored twice for the Knights and Lindsay Westfall notched a single.
Adam Passmore was the winning netminder.
•Killer Beez swarm Avalanche
The Sandman Avalanche edged the Sandman Killer Beez 3-1 in atom recreation action, with Avs goalie Tyson Dmyterko and Beez netminder Garrick Cassidy shining between the pipes.
The Avalanche were led by Logan Clarke (1G), Isaac Tatta (1G), Hudson Irvine (1G) and Colton Davoren (1A). Grace Miller scored for the Beez, on a pass from Evan Guizzo.

description.hltext_display: 22.12.10 - ADAC-Stauprognose für Weihnachten
description.content:
München, 22. Dezember 2010 Die erste Reisewelle rund um Weihnachten rollt Donnerstagnachmittag (23. Dezember) nach Schulschluss. Ab dann gibt es in allen Bundesländern Ferien. Der Heilige Abend am Freitag bleibt dagegen weitgehend staufrei. Am ersten Weihnachtsfeiertag am Samstag aber starten dann die Urlauber. Und am Sonntag, dem zweiten Weihnachtsfeiertag, ist bereits wieder mit lebhaftem Rückreiseverkehr zu rechnen. Die Hauptlast des Weihnachtsverkehrs werden zwar die Strecken in Richtung Skigebiete der Alpen tragen, doch auch auf anderen wichtigen Reiserouten kann es zu Engpässen kommen. Folgende Verbindungen werden laut ADAC am stärksten betroffen sein:
- A 1 / A 7 Großraum Hamburg
- A 1 Bremen Dortmund Köln
- A 2 Dortmund Hannover
- A 3 Köln Frankfurt Nürnberg
- A 5 Frankfurt Karlsruhe Basel
- A 6 Mannheim Heilbronn Nürnberg
- A 7 Hannover Würzburg Füssen
- A 8 Karlsruhe Stuttgart München Salzburg
- A 9 Berlin Nürnberg München
- A 10 Berliner Ring
- A 61 Mönchengladbach Koblenz Ludwigshafen
- A 81 Stuttgart Singen
- A 93 Inntaldreieck Kufstein
- A 95 München Garmisch-Partenkirchen
- A 99 Umfahrung München
In Österreich, Italien und der Schweiz sind Staus auf allen wichtigen Autobahnen programmiert. Zusätzlich müssen Urlauber in den Alpenländern auf allen direkten Zufahrtsstraßen in die Wintersportgebiete mehr Zeit einplanen.
(sl)

تقارير>> 22 كانون الأول, 2010
إدلب-سانا
تنتشر المساحات الخضراء في كل موقع من محافظة ادلب ففي كل غابة تنسج مع شمس الصباح انشودة الطبيعة الغناء بالجمال والخضرة لتغدو المحافظة الخضراء بامتياز.
من هنا بدات الجهود تتحرك للمحافظة على هذه الغابات التي تسودها معدلات امطار مرتفعة وخاصة أن ما نسبته 75 بالمئة من المساحات الخضراء في المحافظة يقع ضمن منطقة الاستقرار الأولى التي تبلغ معدلات الأمطار فيها أكثر من 500 ملم.
ما يعطي لهذه الثروة خصوصية انها باتت تشكل مساحة كبيرة من مساحة المحافظة حيث تتوضع على 82 ألف هكتار وتشكل 13 بالمئة من مساحة المحافظة البالغة 609710 هكتارات وهو ما يشير بوضوح إلى اهمية وضع برامج علمية غايتها النهوض بالغابات والمحافظة عليها.
وأوضح المهندس محمد نور طكو معاون مدير الزراعة ان الزراعة اعتمدت لهذا الغرض مشروعا جديدا وهو مشروع الادارة المتكاملة لحرائق الغابات والعمل عليه لافتا الى ان العمل بالمشروع بدأ منذ العام الماضي ويستمر لمدة 3 سنوات وينفذ بالتعاون بين منظمة الاغذية والزراعة التابعة للامم المتحدة والحكومة السورية والايطالية.
وبين طكو ان هدف المشروع تحقيق الادارة المستدامة للموارد الحراجية وزيادة دورها في تحسين الوضع المعيشي للمجتمعات المحلية و تحقيق الامن الغذائي في المناطق الريفية وتعزيز نتائج المرحلة الاولى للمشروع التي اثمرت عن تاسيس نظام ادارة متكاملة لحرائق الغابات تلاها مرحلة تعزيز دعم القدرات وتوجيه السياسات والقوانين والتشريعات والخطط الاستراتيجية وتطوير القدرة المؤسساتية لمديرية الحراج لتحقيق دمج اكبر ومشاركة فعالة للمجتمعات المحلية في الحفاظ على الغابات ومساقط المياه والاستخدام الامثل للاراضي لتقليل التاثيرات السلبية للحرائق والعمل على بناء قدرات كوادر وحدات ادارة الحرائق وتاسيس نظام ادارة الحرائق.
بدوره أشار أمين الحسن رئيس دائرة الحراج في مديرية الزراعة إلى أنه تم اختيار قرية بكسريا التابعة لمنطقة جسر الشغور كقرية رائدة في محافظة ادلب لتحقيق التنمية الاقتصادية وايجاد فرص استثمار مدرة للدخل والقيام بتدريب السكان للاستفادة من موارد الغابة غير الخشبية وزراعة الغابة وايجاد مشروعات تنموية صغيرة حيث جرى هذا العام اقامة دورات تدريبية لاهالي القرية حول زراعة النباتات الطبية وتاهيلها بدلا من جمعها من الغابة ودورة في مجال تربية النحل ودورة عن تنمية الغابات وتقليم الاشجار من اجل الاستفادة من الاغصان في مجال التدفئة.
من جهته بين قاسم جمعة رئيس مركز حماية الغابات في موقع الزعينية انه تم تدريب عدد من السكان وتاهيلهم في مجال زراعة النباتات الطبية من خلال الاستعانة بمختصين واقامة عدة ندوات في قرية بكسريا بهدف تعريفهم باهمية الغابة والاستماع لمقترحاتهم بشان تطوير الغابة والتي من اهمها مقترح احداث جمعية حراجية بالقرية تعنى بالغابة وطرق الاستفادة منها وخاصة مع وجود اقبال من قبل السكان المحليين حول مسالة زراعة النباتات الطبية في حديقة منازلهم لكون المنطقة جبلية وحراجية وتاهيلهم ومنحهم القروض اللازمة.
وبين عبد الغفور مشيش من اهالي قرية بكسريا اهمية زيادة عدد الدورات والاسراع بمنح القروض من اجل توسيع المشاركة في هذا الجانب موضحا ان احداث جمعية للحراج في القرية من شانه زيادة التفاعل بين المشروع واهالي القرية وان المشروع يحقق جزءا كبيرا من اهدافه وخاصة في مجال تمكين المراة الريفية وتطبيق برامج توعية في المدارس والتي تدعو للحفاظ على الغابة .
وتتوزع الغابات في محافظة ادلب على 42111 هكتارا غابات طبيعية معظمها يتركز في منطقتي جسر الشغور وحارم اضافة إلى 39890 هكتارا غابات اصطناعية.

description.hltext_display: Blazers limp into break
description.content:
Kamloops Blazers captain Chase Schaber competes for a loose puck against the Cougars in Prince George on Saturday, Dec. 28. Kamloops lost the game 3-2.
Alistair McInnis/Black Press
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
Updated: December 21, 2010 2:58 PM
The Kamloops Blazers head into the Christmas break on a losing note after incurring four straight regulation-time road losses, which leave the struggling squad with a 15-18-1-1 record.
Back-to-back 3-2 losses to the Cougars in Prince George on Friday, Dec. 17, and Saturday, Dec. 18, respectively, see the Blazers in the B.C. Division’s basement with 32 points, five points out of a playoff spot in the Western Conference.
Blazer forward Brendan Ranford, who notched 28 goals and 54 points in 34 games, holds a one-point lead over Medicine Hat Tiger Linden Vey in the league’s points race.
On Dec. 27, the Blazers are in Vancouver for the front end of a home-and-home series with the Giants.
The return matchup is scheduled for Dec. 28 at Interior Savings Centre.
TEXT

description.hltext_display: Gemeni, fiţi atenți ce afirmați. Află horoscopul tău aici
description.content:
Astăzi ar fi bine să evitaţi deplasările cu autoturismul. Există pericolul să fiţi implicat într-un accident de circulaţie din vina dvs. Speculaţiile financiare sunt de evitat.
TAUR
Aveţi de rezolvat multe probleme la locul de muncă, dar colegii nu se grăbesc să vă ajute. Dacă nu vă stăpâniţi nervozitatea, riscaţi să faceţi afirmaţii pe care le veţi regreta.
GEMENI
Deveniţi impulsiv din cauza unor neînţelegeri cu şeful direct. Fiţi prudent în afirmaţii! Stăpâniţi-vă nervozitatea în discuţiile cu partenerul de viaţă, altfel riscaţi să tensionaţi atmosfera din familie.
RAC
Primiţi vestea pe care o aşteptaţi de mult timp, în legătură cu plecarea într-o călătorie în interes personal. După o discuţie aprinsă, s-ar putea să amânaţi călătoria sau chiar să renunţaţi.
LEU
Sunteţi cam irascibil, din cauza stresului şi a oboselii acumulate. Evitaţi discuţiile în contradictoriu! Sunteţi predispus la unele probleme de sănătate şi chiar la accidente.
FECIOARĂ
Colaborarea cu un partener de afaceri vă dă dureri de cap. Totul porneşte de la bani.
Dacă reuşiţi să evitaţi o ceartă, perspectivele afacerii sunt foarte bune.
BALANŢĂ
Din cauza unor evenimente neprevăzute, nu vă puteţi respecta programul stabilit.
Nu vă puneţi mari speranţe într-o afacere demarată recent. S-ar putea să fiţi dezamăgit.
SCORPION
Începeţi o activitate care vă poate aduce avantaje materiale, cu condiţia să vă temperaţi spiritul critic. Este recomandabil să fiţi conciliant în discuţiile cu colegii de serviciu şi cu partenerul de viaţă.
SĂGETĂTOR
Un membru mai în vârstă al familiei nu îşi respectă o promisiune în legătură cu o sumă de bani. Nu vă grăbiţi să îi faceţi reproşuri! S-ar putea să aibă motive obiective.
CAPRICORN
Pe plan profesional, eforturile susţinute din perioada precedentă încep să dea roade. Din cauza atmosferei tensionate, relaţiile cu cei din jur pot avea de suferit.
VĂRSĂTOR
Partenerul de viaţă vă face reproşuri neîntemeiate. Păstraţi-vă calmul şi evitaţi o confruntare cu o persoană mai în vârstă din familie!
PEŞTI
S-ar putea să fiţi implicat într-un scandal la locul de muncă din cauza bârfelor unei femei mai în vârstă. Nu răspundeţi la provocări! În scurt timp, situaţia să va lămuri şi totul va reveni la normal.

description.hltext_display: iNet backs Primopost with £10,000 grant
description.content:
A company specialising in producing and printing flexible packaging materials has received a second investment from the Food and Drink iNet. Primopost, based in Buxton in Derbyshire, has secured 10,000 to improve the print quality produced from its flexographic machinery.
Primopost, which has a customer base including United Biscuits and Northern Foods, has matched the iNet investment with its own funding.
It is the second iNet award for Primopost, which earlier this year was given 5,000 worth of support in connection with the same project.
Andrew Foster, managing director of the company which employs 92 people, said: Without the award from the Food and Drink iNet this project would have been extremely difficult to get off the ground. We really appreciate the support we have been given from everyone. Primopost, set up in 1987, specialises in producing flexible packaging material for the food and drink industry.
Foster estimated that the improved printing process would enable Primopost to increase its turnover by about 20 per cent.
Andrew Butterwick, Food and Drink iNet director, said: We were very impressed by Primoposts project. This innovation will enable them to compete with bigger players and at the same time still offer a cost-effective printing solution for the food and drink sector.

description.hltext_display: Commentator Keen on Kamloops
description.content:
Kamloops Blazers play-by-play commentator Jon Keen is pictured at Interior Savings Centre.
Marty Hastings/KTW
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
Updated: December 21, 2010 2:59 PM
It’s Jon Keen’s job to take the radio-listening people of Kamloops inside Interior Savings Centre on Blazers’ game nights and that is exactly what the play-by-play man has done.
A Lanigan, Sask., native, Keen, 32, is a prairie man at heart, but he’s been climbing the broadcast world’s mountain since he was in high school.
“When I was in Grade 8 and Grade 9, I started doing public address announcing at the local Lanigan rink,” recalled Keen during an interview at ISC, occasionally glancing down at the ice from his press-box perch.
“People said, ‘Oh, you’re good at it, you’re good at it.”
And so the journey began.
Keen, who admits his on-ice career as a goaltender had as much promise as Tim Hunter’s career as a male model, often listened to Western Hockey League broadcasts when he was growing up.
“I just thought, ‘Wow, they’re taking me inside the rink right now and I feel like I’m in Seattle, like I’m at this game, with the crowd and the noise,’” Keen said. “It’s the theatre of the mind.”
Drawing inspiration from some of his future colleagues, knowing his playing days would end at the minor-hockey level, Keen traded his goalie mask in for a pair of headphones and a mic.
“The first route to the WHL would have been playing but, when you’re not any good and you can’t make a save . . . ,” said Keen, cutting himself off mid-sentence, refusing to state the obvious.
In his time pursuing a broadcast journalism degree at Lethbridge Community College, Keen would make it hard for play-by-play men across the Dub to forget his face.
“I remember going to the games, covering them as a college kid, and always knocking on the WHL broadcasters’ doors and introducing myself,” said Keen, an avid Saskatchewan Roughriders fan.
“They always said, ‘Hey, that’s great, but get in line, kid.’”
So he did — and it didn’t take long for Keen to jump the cue.
Regan Bartel, now the voice of the Kelowna Rockets, left his post with the Swift Current Broncos in 1999, leaving the door wide open for Joey Kenward, who brought a hungry Keen on as his colour man.
Three years later, Keen realized his dream and took over the play-by-play duties from the departed Kenward.
Keen honed his craft on-air in Swift Current, spending 10 years with the Broncos, calling more than 500 games.
While Keen was growing up in front of Swift Current’s listeners, he watched as young hockey players, with whom he spent countless hours on buses and in hotels on road trips, grew into men.
“There was a player on the Broncos that I saw go from 16 to 20 and really grow up,” said Keen, speaking of former Bronco captain and fan-favourite Luke Hunter.
“At the end of every season, the 20-year-olds would take a lap. I just started crying. Five years with this guy and I could see him crying on the ice. My colour man had to take over. It just goes to show that you really develop a connection with these guys.”
While Keen did mask his emotion that night, he does not believe a play-by-play announcer should remain 100 per cent objective in the broadcast booth.
“People always say you’ve got to be impartial, but screw it,” Keen said.
“I know my audience and I know what they want to hear and you’ve got to cater to that a bit.”
Colour-man Tom Larscheid’s calls with the Vancouver Canucks over the years prove Keen is not the only person in the business who subscribes to that theory.
When former Blazers play-by-play man Kirk Fraser stepped down after 11 seasons and a spot opened up in Kamloops in the summer, Keen had a tough decision to make: To apply or not to apply?
“Here, I had a great setup in Swift and the town and the city had grown on me a lot, but I had to make a decision,” Keen said. “For me, I just didn’t want any regrets down the road. I thought I had to take a shot and take a chance.”
Radio NL operations manager Jim Reynolds decided Keen was the man for the job, and it wasn’t long before he took to Kamloops’ airwaves.
He did get off to an inauspicious start: “The very first time I cracked the mic live here, I said ‘Welcome, it’s the Swift Current Bronco . . . and I cut myself off,’” said Keen, noting it was one of his most embarrassing on-air moments.
One Freudian slip aside, the veteran broadcaster has settled into his new role just fine,
“I always think about what a great job this is and that’s what keeps me going,” Keen said.

description.hltext_display: مصرف سورية المركزي يجري مزادات على سندات الخزينة
description.content:
البيان الختامي لمهرجان الطلبة العالمي السابع عشر يؤكد حق سورية في استعادة الجولان المحتل ودعمه إقامة دولة فلسطينية مستقلة عاصمتها القدس
وزير التربية أمام مؤتمر الالكسو: قطاع التربية في سورية خطا خطوات متقدمة نحو تحقيق نوعية التعليم وجودته
الحكيم قبل لقاء العراق: حالة استقرار تسود منتخبنا الوطني
تداعيات سوء الأحوال الجوية في أوروبا .. استمرار حالات الفوضى وإلغاء الرحلات في مطارات بريطانيا وألمانيا
اقتصاد>> 22 كانون الأول, 2010
دمشق-سانا
قام مصرف سورية المركزي بإجراء مزاد على سندات الخزينة استحقاق 1 سنة و3 سنوات و5 سنوات الأربعاء الماضي عبر الموقعين الالكترونيين لوزارة المالية والمصرف.
وبعد أن حددت وزارة المالية سعر الفائدة على المزادات كانت نتيجة فض العروض المشاركة بالنسبة للمزاد الأول سندات خزينة استحقاق سنة واحدة فوز 5 مصارف عامة وخاصة من أصل 9 مصارف شاركت بالمزاد وسعر الفائدة المرجح للمزاد بـ44ر1 بالمئة ووصل إجمالي حجم العروض المقبولة إلى2ر2 مليار ليرة سورية وبلغ حجم التخصيص للمصارف 1 مليار ليرة سورية وتراوحت أسعار العروض المقدمة بين 1 بالمئة و4 بالمئة وبلغت نسبة تغطية الإصدار 2ر2 مرة.
وفاز بالمزاد الثاني سندات خزينة استحقاق 3 سنوات 3 مصارف عامة من أصل 5 مصارف شاركت بالمزاد وسعر الفائدة المرجح للمزاد 94ر1 بالمئة.
ووصل إجمالي حجم العروض المقبولة إلى 6ر1 مليار ليرة سورية وبلغ حجم التخصيص للمصارف 800 مليون ليرة سورية وتراوحت أسعار العروض المقدمة ما بين 45ر1 بالمئة و5ر5 بالمئة وبلغت نسبة تغطية الإصدار 6ر1 مرة.
وفاز بالمزاد الثالث سندات خزينة استحقاق 5 سنوات 3 مصارف عامة من أصل 6 مصارف شاركت بالمزاد وسعر الفائدة المرجح للمزاد 84ر2 بالمئة.
ووصل إجمالي حجم العروض المقبولة إلى 6ر1 مليار ليرة سورية وحجم التخصيص إلى 800 مليون ليرة سورية وتراوحت أسعار العروض المقدمة بين 30ر2 بالمئة و7 بالمئة وبلغت نسبة تغطية الإصدار 6ر1 مرة.
ويأتي إجراء المزاد على سندات الخزينة بناء على أحكام المرسوم التشريعي رقم 60 لعام 2007 والتعليمات التنفيذية الصادرة بالقرار رقم 1329 لعام 2008 وعلى دليل إجراءات الأوراق المالية المعدل والصادر عن وزير المالية بالقرار رقم 3880 لعام 2010 وعلى كتاب السيد وزير المالية رقم 486 س 2 57 المتضمن موافقة السيد رئيس مجلس الوزراء على إصدار أوراق مالية حكومية بمبلغ 5 مليارات ليرة سورية على شكل أذونات وسندات خزينة.

description.hltext_display: TABLE - PSI-20 opens almost flat on Wednesday
Nemisz loving life with Heat
description.content:
Heat rookie forward Greg Nemisz fends off a Lake Erie Monsters defender.
John Van Putten
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Terrace Standard
Updated: December 21, 2010 3:41 PM
On the topic of promising young hockey teams, Greg Nemisz is something of an authority.
For the four seasons prior to this one, Nemisz was a key player on one of the greatest junior teams of all time – the Ontario Hockey League’s Windsor Spitfires.
Nemisz’s Spitfires secured their legacy by winning back-to-back Memorial Cup championships in 2009 and 2010. He was one of five players from those star-studded title teams – along with Taylor Hall, Adam Henrique, Ryan Ellis and Zack Kassian – to be picked to represent Canada at the World Juniors. Two ex-Spitfires – Hall of the Edmonton Oilers and Cam Fowler of the Anaheim Ducks – are already earning an NHL paycheque.
So when Nemisz says the vibe around the Abbotsford Heat these days reminds him of his early years with the Spitfires, it’s a strong statement.
“I’ve said this to my friends back home a lot – it feels like my first few years in Windsor when we were first coming together,” said Nemisz, a 20-year-old rookie pro, reflecting on his first three months of pro hockey in Abbotsford.
“That’s why we’re winning games – it’s a great group of guys, and it’s fun to come to the rink every day.”
During Nemisz’s rookie season in Windsor, 2006-07, the Spitfires struggled mightily and missed the OHL playoffs with an 18-43-7 record. Two seasons later, of course, Windsor was hoisting the Memorial Cup.
The Heat aren’t approaching that level of dominance in the AHL at this point, but Nemisz sees a parallel in the way the Windsor and Abbotsford clubs go about their business.
The Heat, from all accounts, are unusually tight-knit group that is building a foundation of unselfishness and hard work.
“We went through our struggles when we were younger (in Windsor), but it was just so much fun,” Nemisz said. “We were such a tight-knit group. I still talk to those guys almost every day and see how they’re doing. It was just so amazing, so much fun, and you learn a lot winning championships like that.”
Ask Nemisz what he learned from the championship years in Windsor, and he waxes eloquent on the importance of buying into the team system. It sounds cliché, but the notion of setting aside individual ego for the greater good of the team is a powerful truth.
“We had so many all-stars who, if they had wanted to play on another team, they’d have gotten a lot more power play time and put up a lot more points,” Nemisz pointed out.
“But when you buy into the team system, you learn how to win. Especially in big games, you figure out what it takes to win. That’s something you’ll take with you for the rest of your career.”
The performances of Nemisz and fellow freshmen like T.J. Brodie, Lance Bouma, Carter Bancks and Gaelan Patterson have been pivotal for a youthful Heat squad that has exceeded expectations this season.
With an average age of 23.0 years, Abbotsford’s roster was the AHL’s youngest at the beginning of the 2010-11 campaign. The Hockey News rated the Heat 26th out of 30 teams in its preseason ranking, but through 34 games, the Heat are second in the North Division with a 16-14-4 record.
Nemisz, a first-round pick by the Calgary Flames in 2008 (25th overall), has showcased a well-rounded game as a rookie. He’s tied for the team lead in scoring with 17 points (nine goals, eight assists), and he’s also proven to be an effective penalty killer. His four shorthanded points (three goals, one assist) are tied for second-most in the AHL.
Versatility is something Nemisz seeks to emphasize in his game.
“Being just a scorer, it’s tough to make it (to the NHL),” he noted. “Right now, I’m going through a little bit of a slump offensively, but you try to find ways to contribute in other ways – penalty killing, blocking shots, that sort of thing.”
The Heat have struggled with injuries in the early going, and head coach Jim Playfair pointed out that Nemisz has been the beneficiary.
“There’s been times when he’s earned his minutes, and times when he’s been given his minutes,” Playfair said, alluding to the injury attrition. “I think that’s not always the best way to develop your young players, but he’s certainly taken advantage of it.
“Quite honestly, he’s come a long way in a short period of time in his first year in terms of being a (defensively) responsible player.”
As a first-year pro, a big part of Nemisz’s development is occurring off the ice as he learns to live on his own, rather than with a billet family like in junior hockey. This season, he’s rooming with Brodie, Bryan Cameron and John Negrin.
Cameron described the vibe at their house as “competitive.” The Heat youngsters spend their downtime battling for bragging rights via ping pong or video games.
“Greg and I are definitely the favourites at ping pong, and we have pretty good battles,” Cameron said with a chuckle. “I guess at video games, the best would probably be T.J. Brodie. And Negrin’s the guitar guy.”
Cameron described Nemisz as a level-headed individual, both on and off the ice.
“He’s really calm, and he doesn’t let anything bother him,” he said. “He’s one of those guys who’d do anything for you – just a good guy to be around.”
Nemisz was a member of Canada’s silver medal-winning squad at last season’s World Juniors, and despite falling short of the gold, he termed experience “amazing.”
“You watch it every year since you’re four or five years old, and to be part of it was special,” he said.
This year’s edition of the World Juniors opens on Boxing Day in Buffalo, N.Y., and Nemisz predicted Canada would re-ascend to the top step of the podium. Ellis and Kassian, his ex-Windsor teammates, will wear the maple leaf.
“They don’t have many returning players, but it’s tough not to like Canada’s chances going into the World Juniors every year,” Nemisz noted. “There’s so much talent across the CHL, and there’s always a few more good players in school (NCAA).
“I know once Christmas rolls around, I’ll be watching.”
